meanings.definition: Covered in or adorned with daisies.
meanings.sent1: The gowned field looked beautiful with all the daisies.
meanings.sent2: Her dress was gowned with lovely daisies for the party.
meanings.sent3: The gowned puppy ran happily through the meadow of daisies.
meanings.sent4: The sunset gowned the sky in a soft, daisy-like hue.
meanings.sent5: The gowned garden was a sea of colorful daisies.

meanings.definition: Having a yellow or golden color.
meanings.sent1: The ripe banana had a gowned hue that signaled its sweetness.
meanings.sent2: The gowned sunflowers brightened up the entire field.
meanings.sent3: The gowned lemon looked like a tiny ball of sunshine.
meanings.sent4: Her hair gowned in the sunlight, shining like pure gold.
meanings.sent5: The gowned autumn leaves painted the trees in a golden glow.

meanings.definition: To become golden or yellow in color.
meanings.sent1: The fields gowned as the sun began to set.
meanings.sent2: The leaves gowned slowly as summer turned into fall.
meanings.sent3: The cake gowned perfectly in the oven, turning a lovely golden brown.
meanings.sent4: The old photo gowned with age, taking on a yellowed tint.
meanings.sent5: The painting gowned with each brushstroke, transforming into a masterpiece.
